summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 11, 2019. It demands the production of Jeffrey Epstein's email correspondence and all audio recordings of his telephone calls from July 6-11, 2019, while excluding communications with his attorneys. The subpoena is part of an ongoing federal criminal investigation into suspected felonies.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual whose email correspondence and telephone call records from July 6-11, 2019, are being subpoenaed by the grand jury as part of a federal criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena and accompanying letter to the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys; communications between Epstein and this attorney are specifically excluded from the records requested by the subpoena.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys; communications between Epstein and this attorney are specifically excluded from the records requested by the subpoena.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys; communications between Epstein and this attorney are specifically excluded from the records requested by the subpoena.

persons.name: Eric Blachman
persons.context: The Special Agent designated to receive the records produced in response to the grand jury subpoena if the Metropolitan Correctional Center chooses to produce them without a personal appearance.

connections.description: Epstein is represented by attorney Marc Fernich; their communications are legally privileged and thus excluded from the subpoena.
Epstein is represented by attorney Martin Weinberg; their communications are legally privileged and thus excluded from the subpoena.
Epstein is represented by attorney Reid Weingarten; their communications are legally privileged and thus excluded from the subpoena.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation into Epstein, as evidenced by his issuance of the subpoena for Epstein's communications.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to the Metropolitan Correctional Center demanding Jeffrey Epstein's email and phone records from the preceding days.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the Metropolitan Correctional Center to appear before the grand jury to produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced to Special Agent Eric Blachman by this date.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, New York
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein for suspected felonies under statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement) as of July 11, 2019.

The subpoena sought all of Epstein's email and phone call records from July 6-11, 2019, but explicitly excluded privileged communications with his attorneys Marc Fernich, Martin Weinberg, and Reid Weingarten.

The government requested the Metropolitan Correctional Center to voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
Epstein's inmate number is listed as 76318-054, confirming he was in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York at this time.
